tips.title: Tips
tips.quickIngest: Use Quick ingest to add documents and web pages.
tips.pickModelPrompt: Pick a Model and a Prompt from the header.
tips.startChatFocus: When connected, ‚ÄúStart chatting‚Äù focuses the composer.

empty.title: Start a new chat
empty.description: Experiment with different models, prompts, and knowledge sources here.
empty.demoDescription: You‚Äôre in demo mode ‚Äî try asking a question to see how the assistant responds. You can connect your own tldw server later to save chats, ingest media, and use Knowledge search.
empty.example1: Ask a question, then drag in documents or web pages you want to discuss.
empty.example2: Use Quick ingest to add transcripts or notes, then reference them in chat.
empty.example3: Try different prompts or models from the header to compare answers.

formError.noEmbeddingModel: Please set an embedding model on the Settings > RAG page

drop.hint: Drop files to attach them to your message
drop.unsupported: That file type isn‚Äôt supported. Try images or text-based files.
drop.imageOnly: Only images can be dropped here right now.
drop.imageHint: Drop an image to include it in your message
drop.overlayInstruction: Drop the image to attach it to your next reply

tooltip.speechToTextDetails: Uses {{model}} ¬∑ {{task}} ¬∑ {{format}}. Configure in Settings ‚Üí General ‚Üí Speech-to-Text.
tooltip.quickIngest: Stage URLs and files for processing, even while your server is offline.

welcome: Hello! How can I help you today?

stt.title: STT Playground
stt.subtitle: Try out transcription models, run longer dictation sessions, and save transcripts into Notes.
stt.settingsNotice: Language, task, response format, segmentation, and prompt reuse your Speech-to-Text defaults from Settings.
stt.emptyHistory: Start a recording to see transcripts here. You can save any item into Notes.
stt.currentTranscriptPlaceholder: Live transcript will appear here while recording.

actions.ingestDisabled: Connect to your tldw server to ingest.
actions.ingestHint: Upload URLs or files with advanced options.

queuedBanner.title: Queued while offline
queuedBanner.body: We‚Äôll hold these messages and send them once your tldw server is connected.

composer.connectionPlaceholder: Connect to your tldw server in Settings to send messages and view media.
composer.connectNotice: Connect to your tldw server in Settings to send messages and view media.
composer.contextMediaHint: Attach Media & Notes that should steer the response.
composer.contextTabsHint: Review or remove referenced tabs, or add more from your open browser tabs.

persistence.ephemeral: Temporary chat: not saved in history and cleared when you close this window.
persistence.local: Saved locally in this browser only (not synced to your tldw server).
persistence.saveToServer: Also save this chat to server
persistence.connectToSave: Connect your server to save chats there.
persistence.serverSaved: Future messages in this chat will sync to your tldw server.
persistence.serverBenefits: This keeps a durable record in server history so you can reopen the conversation later, access it from other browsers, and run server-side analytics over your chats.
persistence.serverCharacterRequired: Unable to find or create a default assistant character on the server. Try again from the Characters page.
persistence.serverCharacterHintBody: Create a simple assistant persona (name and a short description are enough). Once it exists, the extension can reuse it when saving chats to your server.
persistence.serverInlineBody: This chat is stored both in this browser and on your tldw server, so you can reopen it from server history, keep a long-term record, and analyze it alongside other conversations.

composer.stateHelp: Default state is ‚Äúin-progress.‚Äù Update it as the conversation progresses.
composer.saveSnippetHelp: Store this message as a knowledge snippet with a backlink to this conversation.
composer.saveSnippetError: Failed to save snippet. Check your connection and try again.
composer.connectToSend: Connect to your tldw server in Settings to send messages and view media.

actor.title: Scene Director (Actor)
actor.help: Configure per-chat scene context: roles, mood, world, goals, and notes.
actor.addLabel: Add or remove aspects to focus the scene.
actor.notesHelp: Optional notes sent to the model. Supports Markdown and LaTeX.
actor.depthHelp: Used only when position is "In-chat at depth". Counts non-system messages from the top of the chat.
actor.positionHelp: Depth is only used when position is "In-chat at depth". Role controls whether Actor appears as system, user, or assistant.
actor.offlineHintTitle: World Books not available for Actor
actor.offlineHintBody: Connect to your tldw server from Settings to use World Books for Actor aspects, or keep using free-text values.
actor.loreWorldBookMissing: Previous world book binding was not found; using free text instead.
actor.loreEntryMissing: Previous world book entry was not found; using free text instead.
actor.tokensHelp: Use these tokens in prompts and system messages.
actor.keyChangeBody: This will change the token from {{old}} to {{next}}. Prompts using the old token won't update automatically.
actor.keyCollisionBody: Another aspect already uses this key. Keys must be unique per chat.
actor.aspectLimitWarningTitle: Many aspects configured for this chat
actor.aspectLimitWarningBody: You have {{count}} aspects (soft limit {{limit}}). Consider trimming to focus the scene and save tokens.
actor.tokenWarning: Actor prompt is long ({{count}} tokens; soft limit {{limit}}). Consider trimming aspects or notes to save context.
actor.depthRangeHelp: Depth must be between 0 and 999; values beyond history length are clamped.
actor.notesGmOnly: GM-only: do not send notes to the model
actor.templateModeHelp: Controls how Actor interacts with active scene templates. Merge keeps both; Override lets Actor replace overlapping fields; Ignore skips Actor when templates are active.
actor.summaryTokensEmpty: No tokens defined yet; set aspect values.
actor.sceneTemplateActive: Scene template active: Actor respects template interaction settings.

tts.title: TTS Playground
tts.subtitle: Try out text-to-speech and tweak providers, models, and voices.
tts.settingsIntro: Adjust your TTS provider, model, and voice. These settings are reused when you play audio from chat or media.
tts.inputLabel: Enter some text to hear it spoken.
tts.inputPlaceholder: Type or paste text here, then use Play to listen.
tts.playHelper: Play uses your selected provider, voice, and speed.
tts.playDisabledTtsOff: Enable text-to-speech above to play audio.
tts.providerChangeHelper: Open the provider selector above to switch between Browser, tldw, OpenAI, or Supersonic.
tts.tldwStatusOffline: Audio API not detected; check your tldw server version.
tts.tldwWarningBody: Ensure your tldw_server version includes /api/v1/audio/speech and that your extension is connected with a valid API key.
tts.speechErrorBody: Transcription request failed. Check tldw server health.
tts.speechNoText: The transcription did not return any text.
tts.speechMicError: Unable to access your microphone. Check browser permissions and try again.
tts.playErrorDescription: Something went wrong while trying to play the audio
tts.browserInfoDescription: Browser TTS plays using your system synthesizer and does not expose an audio file. Use ElevenLabs, OpenAI TTS, or tldw to see a track list and player.
tts.unsupportedProviderDescription: The provider "{{provider}}" is not yet supported in the playground player.
tts.generateErrorDescription: Something went wrong while generating TTS audio.

tldwState.title: Waiting for your tldw server
tldwState.subtitle: We‚Äôre pinging {{host}} to verify the connection.
tldwState.notRunning: Unable to connect to tldw server üö®
tldwState.noServer: Add your tldw server to start chatting.
tldwState.connectedSubtitle: Connected to {{host}}. Start chatting when you‚Äôre ready.
tldwState.errorSubtitle: We couldn‚Äôt reach {{host}} yet. Retry or update your server settings.
tldwState.missingHelp: Open Settings ‚Üí tldw Server to add your URL or connect to the Options page.
tldwState.troubleshoot: Confirm your server is running and that the browser is allowed to reach it, then retry from the Options page.

errors.privateModeDescription: Firefox Private Mode does not support saving chat. Temporary chat is enabled by default. More fixes coming soon.
